thread.title: Barcelona star Neymar suffering worst year in front of goal since he was 17 after failing to score since October
thread.title_full: Barcelona star Neymar suffering worst year in front of goal since he was 17 after failing to score since October

author: gboulton
title: Barcelona star Neymar suffering worst year in front of goal since he was 17 after failing to score since October
text:
EFL Year to forget Barcelona star Neymar suffering worst year in front of goal since he was 17 after failing to score since October 
Samba star's goal drought stretches over nine games and last netted against Manchester City at the Nou Camp in October By George Boulton Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BARCELONA ace Neymar is suffering his worst season in front of goal since he was a 17-year-old at Santos. 
The 24-year-old will finish 2016 with just 29 goals for both Brazil and the La Liga champions and is currently experiencing a goal drought of nine games stretching back until October. Getty Images 4 It has been a frustrating season for Neymar in front of goal 
The tricky winger last found the back of net when Barca hosted Manchester City in the Champions League, with the hosts winning 4-0 . 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog 
It has been a disappointing year for the Brazilian in front of goal, despite winning La Liga, the Copa del Rey and the Super Cup with Barcelona as well as guiding his nation to Gold at the Olympics in Rio as captain. 
But a reflection of how poor Neymar has been in front of goal this year, is that in 2015 he scored 17 more goals with a total of 46. 
And his current tally of 29 is his worst since 2009 which was when he broke into the first team at Santos where he eventually went on to bag 15 goals. Neymar annual goal return Neymar’s goalscoring form in 2016 is his worst since his debut season at Santos Reuters 4 The Brazilian’s last goal came against Manchester City at the Nou Camp 
A reason as to why Neymar’s goal count may have dropped significantly is because he has become more of a creative player within Luis Enriques side. 
The Samba star has certainly pulled his weight in this department after topping the assist chart in Champions League with seven. 
Whilst also having seven to his name in La Liga as he his on par with the league leaders Toni Kroos of Real Madrid and Espanyol’s Pablo Piatti. Related Stories Gunners' day care Arsenal keen on Salzburg kid Upamecano but Red Bull link gives German title chasers Leipzig edge HANDS OFF AC Milan to offer Gianluigi Donnarumma FIVE TIMES his current deal to scare off Man Utd, Liverpool and Barca Cap in hand Samuel Eto'o thanks Fabio Capello for allowing his family to eat and applauds 48-team World Cup cats strapped for cash Barcelona left with just £21million to spend in 2017 after splurge on Paco Alcacer and Andre Gomes sleeping with the enemies TV beauty claims to have bedded FOUR Barcelona and Real Madrid stars Neym A Price Barcelona ace Neymar reveals the one club he wants to play for when he calls time on Nou Camp adventure 
But despite Neymar’s tame year in front of goal, his deadly strike partners Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez have maintained their clinical form this year. 
With Messi scoring 59 in 2016, whilst Suarez has netted eight less with 51. AP:Associated Press Luis Suarez (left) and Lionel Messi (right) have maintained their goalscoring form in 2016 Neymar leads tributes to Chapecoense victims at charity game
